intro: Premna rabakensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Premna rabakensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
